base_memory.title: The base memory for the container

memory_ratio.title: The amount of memory to allocate per units of CPU

resources.title: Use flexible resources.
resources.description: Adjust the amount of memory using the resources key in your Platform.sh app configuration. All memory must stay within the limits set by your plan.

container_profile.title: The container profile for this application in production. Leave blank to allow it to be set dynamically.

access.title: Access control for roles accessing app environments.

relationships.title: The relationships of the application to other services and apps.

source.title: The type of mount that will provide the data.
source.description:
- By design, `storage` mounts can be shared between instances of the same app
- `instance` mounts are local mounts
- `tmp` (or `temporary`) mounts are local ephemeral mounts
- `service` mounts can be useful if you want to explicitly define and use a Network Storage service

source_path.title: The path to be mounted, relative to the root directory of the volume that's being mounted from.
source_path.description: WARNING: Changing the name of your mount affects the source_path when it’s undefined. See how to ensure continuity and maintain access to your files\nhttps://docs.upsun.com/create-apps/app-reference/single-runtime-image.html#ensure-continuity-when-changing-the-name-of-your-mount

service.title: The name of the service that the volume will be mounted from. Must be a service in `services.yaml` of type `network-storage`.

mounts.title: Filesystem mounts of this application.
mounts.description: Directories that are writable even after the app is built. Allocated disk for mounts is defined with a separate resource configuration call using `upsun resources:set`.\nContains a dictionary of mounts:\nhttps://docs.upsun.com/create-apps/app-reference/single-runtime-image.html#mounts

timezone.title: The timezone of the application.
timezone.description: This primarily affects the timezone in which cron tasks will run.  It will not affect the application itself. Defaults to UTC if not specified.\nSee also:\nhttps://docs.upsun.com/create-apps/timezone.html

variables.title: Variables to control the environment.
variables.description: Variables provide environment-sensitive information to control how your application behaves. To set a Unix environment variable, specify a key of `env:`, and then each sub-item of that is a key/value pair that will be injected into the environment.\nMore information:\nhttps://docs.upsun.com/create-apps/app-reference/single-runtime-image.html#variables

protocol.title: The IP protocol to apply the restriction on.

ips.title: The IP range in CIDR notation to apply the restriction on.

domains.title: Domains of the restriction.
domains.description: Fully qualified domain names to specify specific destinations by hostname\nhttps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fully_qualified_domain_name

ports.title: The port to apply the restriction on.
ports.description: Ports from 1 to 65535 that are allowed. If any ports are specified, all unspecified ports are blocked. If no ports are specified, all ports are allowed. Port 25, the SMTP port for sending email, is always blocked.

firewall.title: Outbound firewall rules for the application.

type.title: The base runtime (language) and version to use for this application.
type.description:
The base image to use with a specific app language. 
Format: runtime:version.
More information:
https://docs.upsun.com/create-apps/app-reference/single-runtime-image.html#types

runtime.title: Runtime-specific configuration.
runtime.description: Customizations to your PHP or Lisp runtime.\nContains a runtime dictionary:\nhttps://docs.upsun.com/create-apps/app-reference/single-runtime-image.html#runtime

request_terminate_timeout.title: PHP timeout to terminate requests.
request_terminate_timeout.description: The timeout in seconds for serving a single request after which the PHP-FPM worker process is killed.

sizing_hints.title: A sizing hints definition.
sizing_hints.description: The assumptions for setting the number of workers in your PHP-FPM runtime.\nMore information:\nhttps://docs.upsun.com/create-apps/app-reference/single-runtime-image.html#sizing-hints

request_memory.title: The average memory consumed per request in MB.

reserved_memory.title: The amount of memory reserved in MB.

xdebug.title: An Xdebug definition
xdebug.description: The setting to turn on Xdebug.\nMore information:\nhttps://docs.upsun.com/languages/php/xdebug.html

quicklisp.title: Distributions for QuickLisp to use.
quicklisp.deprecationMessage: Lisp image no longer exists, please see\nhttps://devcenter.upsun.com/posts/deploying-with-lisp/\n for more information

enabled.title: Whether the preflight security blocks are enabled.

ignored_rules.title: Specific rules to ignore during preflight security checks. See the documentation for options.

dependencies.title: External global dependencies of this application.
dependencies.description: What global dependencies to install before the build `hook` is run. They will be downloaded by the language's package manager. \nMore information:\nhttps://docs.upsun.com/create-apps/app-reference/single-runtime-image.html#dependencies

flavor.title: The pre-set build tasks to use for this application.

build.title: The build configuration of the application.

root.title: The root of the application relative to the repository root.
root.description:
Defaults to the root project directory. 
Useful for multi-app setups:
https://docs.upsun.com/create-apps/multi-app.html

command.title: Operations that can be applied to the source code.

operations.title: Operations that can be applied to the source code.

source.title: Information on the app’s source code and operations that can be run on it.

web.title: How the web application is served.

variables.title: Variables provide environment-sensitive information to control how your application behaves.  To set a Unix environment variable, specify a key of `env:`, and then each sub-item of that is a key/value pair that will be injected into the environment.

timezone.title: The timezone of the application.  This primarily affects the timezone in which cron tasks will run.  It will not affect the application itself. Defaults to UTC if not specified.

source.title: The type of mount that will provide the data.

source_path.title: The path to be mounted, relative to the root directory of the volume that's being mounted from.

service.title: The name of the service that the volume will be mounted from. Must be a service in `services.yaml` of type `network-storage`.

mounts.title: Filesystem mounts of this application.  If not specified the application will have no writeable disk space.

relationships.title: The relationships of the application to defined services.

access.title: Access information, a mapping between access type and roles.

size.title: The container size for this application in production. Leave blank to allow it to be set dynamically.

base_memory.title: The base memory for the container

memory_ratio.title: The amount of memory to allocate per units of CPU

root.title: The folder from which to serve static assets for this location relative to the application root.
root.description: The directory to serve static assets for this location relative to the app’s root directory. Must be an actual directory inside the root directory.\nMore information:\nhttps://docs.upsun.com/create-apps/app-reference/single-runtime-image.html#root-directory

expires.title: Amount of time to cache static assets.
expires.description: How long static assets are cached. The default means no caching. Setting it to a value enables the `Cache-Control` and `Expires` headers. Times can be suffixed with `ms` = milliseconds, `s` = seconds, `m` = minutes, `h` = hours, `d` = days, `w` = weeks, `M` = months/30d, or `y` = years/365d. If a `Cache-Control` appears on the `headers` configuration, `expires`, if set, will be ignored. Thus, make sure to set the `Cache-Control`’s `max-age` value when specifying a the header.

passthru.title: Whether to forward disallowed and missing resources from this location to the app.
passthru.description: Whether to forward disallowed and missing resources from this location to the application. On PHP, set to the PHP front controller script, as a URL fragment. Otherwise set to `true`/`false`.

scripts.title: Whether to allow scripts to run.
scripts.description: Doesn't apply to paths specified in `passthru`. Meaningful only on PHP containers.

index.title: Files to look for to serve directories.
index.description: Files to consider when serving a request for a directory. When set, requires access to the files through the `allow` or `rules` keys.

allow.title: Whether to allow serving files which don’t match a rule.

headers.title: A set of header fields set to the HTTP response.
headers.description: Any additional headers to apply to static assets, mapping header names to values. Responses from the app aren’t affected.\nSee how to set custom headers on static content:\nhttps://docs.upsun.com/create-apps/web/custom-headers.html

expires.title: Amount of time to cache static assets.
expires.description: How long static assets are cached. The default means no caching. Setting it to a value enables the `Cache-Control` and `Expires` headers. Times can be suffixed with `ms` = milliseconds, `s` = seconds, `m` = minutes, `h` = hours, `d` = days, `w` = weeks, `M` = months/30d, or `y` = years/365d. If a `Cache-Control` appears on the `headers` configuration, `expires`, if set, will be ignored. Thus, make sure to set the `Cache-Control`’s `max-age` value when specifying a the header.

passthru.title: Whether to forward disallowed and missing resources from this location to the app.
passthru.description: On PHP, set to the PHP front controller script, as a URL fragment. Otherwise set to `true`/`false`.

scripts.title: Whether to allow scripts to run.
scripts.description: Doesn't apply to paths specified in `passthru`. Meaningful only on PHP containers.

allow.title: Whether to allow serving files which don’t match a rule.

headers.title: A set of header fields set to the HTTP response.
headers.description: Any additional headers to apply to static assets, mapping header names to values. Responses from the app aren’t affected.\nSee how to set custom headers on static content:\nhttps://docs.upsun.com/create-apps/web/custom-headers.html

max_request_size.title: The maximum size request that can be buffered. Supports K, M, and G suffixes.

locations.title: The specification of the web locations served by this application.

pre_start.title: Command run just prior to `start`, which can be useful when you need to run per-instance actions.

start.title: The command used to start the application. It will be restarted if it terminates. Do not use on PHP unless using a custom persistent process like React PHP or FrankenPHP.\nSee note:\nhttps://docs.upsun.com/create-apps/app-reference/single-runtime-image.html#required-command

commands.title: The command to launch your app.

socket_family.title: If `tcp`, check the PORT environment variable on application startup. If `unix`, check SOCKET.

upstream.title: Configuration on how the web server communicates with the application.

document_root.title: The document root of this application, relative to its root.

passthru.title: The URL to use as a passthru if a file doesn't match the whitelist.

index_files.title: Files to look for to serve directories.

expires.title: Amount of time to cache static assets.

move_to_root.title: Whether to move the whole root of the app to the document root.

start.title: The command used to start the application.  It will be restarted if it terminates. Do not use on PHP unless using a custom persistent process like React PHP.

role.title: The command used to start the application.  It will be restarted if it terminates. Do not use on PHP unless using a custom persistent process like React PHP.

operations.title: Runtime operations that can be executed in the application container.

build.title: Hook executed after the build process.

deploy.title: Hook executed after the deployment of new code.

post_deploy.title: Hook executed after an environment is fully deployed.

hooks.title: What commands run at different stages in the `build`, `deploy` and `post_deploy` process.

spec.title: The cron schedule specification.
spec.description: The cron specification. To prevent competition for resources that might hurt performance, use `H` in definitions to indicate an unspecified but invariant time. For example, instead of using `0 * * * *` to indicate the cron job runs at the start of every hour, you can use `H * * * *` to indicate it runs every hour, but not necessarily at the start. This prevents multiple cron jobs from trying to start at the same time.\nMore information:\nhttps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cron#Cron_expression

start.title: The command used to start the cron job.
start.description: By default, the command is run in Dash (till you specify something else):\nhttps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Almquist_shell

stop.title: The command used to stop the cron job.
stop.description: The command that’s issued to give the cron command a chance to shutdown gracefully, such as to finish an active item in a list of tasks. Issued when a cron task is interrupted by a user through the CLI or Console. If not specified, a `SIGTERM` signal is sent to the process.

commands.title: A definition of what commands to run when starting and stopping the cron job.

shutdown_timeout.title: The timeout in seconds after which the cron job will be forcefully killed.
shutdown_timeout.description: When a cron is canceled, this represents the number of seconds after which a `SIGKILL` signal is sent to the process to force terminate it. The default is `10` seconds.

timeout.title: The cron timeout.
timeout.description: The maximum amount of time a cron can run before it’s terminated. Defaults to the maximum allowed value of `86400` seconds (24 hours).

crons.title: Scheduled cron tasks executed by this application.

protocol.title: The IP protocol to apply the restriction on.

ips.title: The IP range in CIDR notation to apply the restriction on.

domains.title: Domains of the restriction.
domains.description: Fully qualified domain names to specify specific destinations by hostname\nhttps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fully_qualified_domain_name

ports.title: The port to apply the restriction on.
ports.description: Ports from 1 to 65535 that are allowed. If any ports are specified, all unspecified ports are blocked. If no ports are specified, all ports are allowed. Port 25, the SMTP port for sending email, is always blocked.

firewall.title: Outbound firewall rules for the application.

variables.title: Variables to control the environment.
variables.description: Variables provide environment-sensitive information to control how your application behaves. To set a Unix environment variable, specify a key of `env:`, and then each sub-item of that is a key/value pair that will be injected into the environment.\nMore information:\nhttps://docs.upsun.com/create-apps/app-reference/single-runtime-image.html#variables

timezone.title: The timezone of the application.
timezone.description: This primarily affects the timezone in which cron tasks will run.  It will not affect the application itself. Defaults to UTC if not specified.\nSee also:\nhttps://docs.upsun.com/create-apps/timezone.html

source.title: The type of mount that will provide the data.
source.description:
- By design, `storage` mounts can be shared between instances of the same app
- `instance` mounts are local mounts
- `tmp` (or `temporary`) mounts are local ephemeral mounts
- `service` mounts can be useful if you want to explicitly define and use a Network Storage service

source_path.title: The path to be mounted, relative to the root directory of the volume that's being mounted from.
source_path.description: WARNING: Changing the name of your mount affects the source_path when it’s undefined. See how to ensure continuity and maintain access to your files\nhttps://docs.upsun.com/create-apps/app-reference/single-runtime-image.html#ensure-continuity-when-changing-the-name-of-your-mount

service.title: The name of the service that the volume will be mounted from. Must be a service in `services.yaml` of type `network-storage`.

mounts.title: Filesystem mounts of this application.
mounts.description: Directories that are writable even after the app is built. Allocated disk for mounts is defined with a separate resource configuration call using `upsun resources:set`.\nContains a dictionary of mounts:\nhttps://docs.upsun.com/create-apps/app-reference/single-runtime-image.html#mounts

relationships.title: The relationships of the application to other services and apps.

access.title: Access control for roles accessing app environments.

size.title: The container size for this application in production. Leave blank to allow it to be set dynamically.

base_memory.title: The base memory for the container

memory_ratio.title: The amount of memory to allocate per units of CPU

pre_start.title: The command used to run before starting the application.

start.title: The command used to start the application. It will be restarted if it terminates. Do not use on PHP unless using a custom persistent process like React PHP.

post_start.title: A command executed after the application is started.

commands.title: The commands to manage the worker.

workers.title: Alternate copies of the application to run as background processes.

additional_hosts.title: Maps of hostnames to IP addresses.

stack.title: Composable Image definition
stack.description: A list of packages from the Upsun collection of supported runtimes and/or from NixPkgs. \nMore information:\nhttps://docs.upsun.com/create-apps/app-reference/composable-image.html

routes.title: The routes of the project
routes.description: Each route describes how an incoming URL is going to be processed by Upsun.\nMore information: \nhttps://docs.upsun.com/define-routes.html

primary.description: If true, this route is the primary route of the environment

id.title: Route Identifier
id.description: A unique identifier for the route. See route identifiers:\nhttps://docs.upsun.com/define-routes.html#route-identifiers

redirects.title: The configuration of the redirects.
redirects.description: Defines redirects for partial routes. For definition and options, see the redirect rules:\nhttps://docs.upsun.com/define-routes/redirects.html

expires.description: The duration the redirect is cached. Examples of valid values include 3600s, 1d, 2w, 3m.\nTo disable caching for all your redirects, set expires to 0. You can also disable caching on a specific redirect: \nhttps://docs.upsun.com/define-routes/redirects.html#disable-caching-on-your-redirects

regexp.description: Whether the path is a regular expression.

prefix.title: Prefix of the redirect path
prefix.description: Specifies whether both the path and all its children or just the path itself should be redirected. \nMore information:\nhttps://docs.upsun.com/define-routes/redirects.html#redirects-using-prefix-and-append_suffix

append_suffix.title: Suffix of the redirect path
append_suffix.description: Determines if the suffix is carried over with the redirect. More information.\nhttps://docs.upsun.com/define-routes/redirects.html#redirects-using-prefix-and-append_suffix

code.title: The redirect HTTP status code to use.
code.description:
Valid status codes are 301, 302, 307, and 308. 
Defaults to 302 for Partial redirects:
https://docs.upsun.com/define-routes/redirects.html#partial-redirects
and 301 for Whole-route redirects:
https://docs.upsun.com/define-routes/redirects.html#whole-route-redirects
More information: 
https://docs.upsun.com/define-routes/redirects.html#specify-a-http-status-code

expires.title: The amount of time, in seconds, to cache the redirects.
expires.description: The duration the redirect is cached for. \nMore information:\nhttps://docs.upsun.com/define-routes/redirects.html#manage-caching

tls.title: TLS settings for the route.
tls.description: The absolute URL or other route to which the given route should be redirected with an HTTP 301 status code.\nhttps://docs.upsun.com/define-routes/https.html#optional-configure-tls-connections

enabled.title: Whether strict transport security is enabled or not.
enabled.description: If set to true, HSTS is enabled for 1 year. \nIf set to false, other properties are ignored.

include_subdomains.description: Whether the strict transport security policy should include all subdomains.

preload.title: Whether the strict transport security policy should be preloaded in browsers.
preload.description: To add your website to the HSTS preload list:\nhttps://hstspreload.org/.\nThanks to this list, most browsers are informed that your site requires HSTS before an HSTS header response is even issued.

min_version.title: The minimum TLS version to support.
min_version.description: Note that TLS versions older than 1.2 are deprecated and are rejected by default.

client_authentication.description: The type of client authentication to request.

client_certificate_authorities.description: Certificate authorities to validate the client certificate against. If not specified, a default set of trusted CAs will be used.\nMore Information:\nhttps://docs.upsun.com/define-routes/https.html#enable-mtls

to.title: Redirect destination
to.description: The absolute URL or other route to which the given route should be redirected with an HTTP 301 status code.

primary.title: This route is the primary route of the environment

attributes.title: Arbitrary attributes attached to this resource

expires.title: The amount of time, in seconds, to cache the redirects.

regexp.title: Whether the path is a regular expression.

prefix.title: Whether to redirect all the paths that start with the path.

append_suffix.title: Whether to append the incoming suffix to the redirected URL.

expires.title: The amount of time, in seconds, to cache the redirects.

enabled.title: Whether strict transport security is enabled or not.

include_subdomains.title: Whether the strict transport security policy should include all subdomains.

preload.title: Whether the strict transport security policy should be preloaded in browsers.

min_version.title: The minimum TLS version to support.

client_authentication.title: The type of client authentication to request.

client_certificate_authorities.title: Certificate authorities to validate the client certificate against. If not specified, a default set of trusted CAs will be used.

default_ttl.title: The TTL to apply when the response doesn't specify one. Only applies to static files.

cookies.title: The cookies to take into account for the cache key.

headers.title: The headers to take into account for the cache key.

upstream.title: The upstream to use for this route.

services.title: The services of the project
services.description:
Each service listed will be deployed to power your Upsun project. 
More information: 
https://docs.upsun.com/add-services.html
Full list of available services: 
https://docs.upsun.com/add-services.html#available-services

type.title: The service type.
type.description: One of the available services in the format `type:version`.\nMore information: \nhttps://docs.upsun.com/add-services.html#available-services

configuration.title: The configuration of the service.
configuration.description: Some services have additional specific configuration options that can be defined here, such as specific endpoints.\nSee the given service page for more details: \nhttps://docs.upsun.com/add-services.html#available-services.

relationships.title: The relationships of the service to other services.
relationships.description: Some services require a relationship to your app. The content of the dictionary has the same type as the relationships dictionary for app configuration \nhttps://docs.upsun.com/create-apps/app-reference/single-runtime-image.html#relationships\nThe endpoint_name for apps is always `http`.

protocol.title: The IP protocol to apply the restriction on.

ips.title: The IP range in CIDR notation to apply the restriction on.

ports.title: The port to apply the restriction on.

base_memory.title: The base memory for the container

memory_ratio.title: The amount of memory to allocate per units of CPU
